jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly Brit.)(of a person or situation) have a better performance or outcome than expected
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主英)（人的表现、情况等）比预计好

lj.lj_ly: Conrad came up trumps again, finishing fourth in the 800 metres.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: alteration of triumph, once used in card games in the same sense
Middle English: from Old French trompe, of Germanic origin; probably imitative

entry.def: In a game of cards, trumps is the suit which is chosen to have the highest value in one particular game.
In a game of cards, a trump is a playing card which belongs to the suit which has been chosen as trumps.
If you trump what someone has said or done, you beat it by saying or doing something else that seems better.

example.ex: The Socialists tried to trump this with their slogan...
example.tran: 社会党党员设法用他们的口号把它压过去。

example.ex: The Hong Kong and Shanghai Bank has trumped Lloyds by raising its offer.
example.tran: 汇丰银行通过提高报价击败了劳埃德保险公司。

entry.def: Your trump card is something powerful that you can use or do, which gives you an advantage over someone.

example.ex: In the end, the Ten took their appeal to the Supreme Court; this, they had believed from the outset, would be their trump card...
example.tran: 最后，10 个人上诉到最高法院：他们从一开始就认为这一招是他们的王牌。

example.ex: She could threaten to play her trump card, an autobiography of embarrassing disclosures.
example.tran: 她可能会威胁要拿出她的杀手锏：出自传来爆料糗事。

entry.tran: 意外地胜利;意外地成功
entry.def: If you say that someone came up trumps, you mean that they did something successfully, often when they were not expected to.

example.ex: Dwayne has come up trumps with a goal worthy of winning any match.
example.tran: 德韦恩意外地蒙进了一个可以拿下任何比赛的球。

means.word_mean: 1. a playing card in the suit that has been declared trumps
2. a brass musical instrument with a brilliant tone; has a narrow tube and a flared bell and is played by means of valves
1. produce a sound as if from a trumpet

sentences.sentence: "the goal was to best the competition"

means.word_mean: 4. proclaim or announce with or as if with a fanfare

auth_sentence.content: In this study, timing seems to trump concentration.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: In this study, timing seems to trump concentration.

auth_sentence.content: The best of his legacy must trump its worst.
auth_sentence.res_content: The best of his legacy must trump its worst.

Sentence.sentence: As advocates of the sharing economy like to put it, access trumps ( 胜过) ownership.

sentences.en: I had to play a trump to win the trick.
sentences.cn: 我只好打出王牌才赢得这一墩。

sentences.en: That woman trumped up various baseless charges against him.
sentences.cn: 那个女人捏造种种毫无根据的罪名指控他。

sentences.en: Several of his colleagues trumped up a complaint to get him removed from the job.
sentences.cn: 他的几位同事诬告他,使他丟掉了工作。

sentences.en: It became clear,during the trial,that most of the charges against the defendant were trumped up.
sentences.cn: 在审判中已搞清楚了,对被告的大部分指控是捏造的。

means.word_mean: (出乎意料地)令人满意；格外地慷慨大方(或帮忙)

sentences.en: I asked a lot of people if they could lend me the money, but finally it was my sister who came up trumps.
sentences.cn: 我向很多人请求过帮助,但最后还是我姐姐伸出了援手,借钱给我。

means.word_mean: (出乎意料地)令人满意；格外地慷慨大方(或帮忙)

sentences.en: On the day of the match the team turned up trumps.
sentences.cn: 比赛那天该队出乎意料地获得胜利。
